page.title: 16LAND USE
page.content: The small area investigated had within its perimeter numerous fields, two woods and three farms. The names of the farms are: Wood Farm, Outwood Farm, and Overfields Farm. The main area - 44% was grassland used for pasture or for fodder. 35% was rough grassland, for animal grazing. Woodland covers 10% of the area. (5% coniferous, 5% deciduous.) Uncultivated grassland covers 8% of the area, and pipeline (oil from Southampton to Wolverhampton) construction another 3%. The coniferous woodland was originally part of Chaddesley Woods, a part of the Royal Forest of Feckenham. { { P. Hatfield. T. Donald.
